main_definition: Judgment refers to the ability to make considered decisions or form opinions, as well as a formal decision made by a judge in court.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The power or right of judging or forming an opinion
meanings_and_examples.example: Her strong sense of judgment helps her to make quick decisions.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A formal decision made by a judge after due consideration
meanings_and_examples.example: After hearing all the evidence, the judge handed down his judgment on the case.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An opinion formed about something or someone without full information
meanings_and_examples.example: I had a negative judgment of him before even meeting him; it turned out he was very kind and friendly.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The act of forming an opinion by judging
meanings_and_examples.example: Judgment is the process through which we form opinions about others based on their actions or words.
